001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of
003// the WPILib BSD license file in the root directory of this project.
004
005package edu.wpi.first.hal;
006
007public class SimDeviceJNI extends JNIWrapper {
008  public static final int kInput = 0;
009  public static final int kOutput = 1;
010  public static final int kBidir = 2;
011
012  /**
013   * Creates a simulated device.
014   *
015   * <p>The device name must be unique. 0 is returned if the device name already exists. If multiple
016   * instances of the same device are desired, recommend appending the instance/unique identifer in
017   * brackets to the base name, e.g. "device[1]".
018   *
019   * <p>0 is returned if not in simulation.
020   *
021   * @param name device name
022   * @return simulated device handle
023   */
024  public static native int createSimDevice(String name);
025
026  /**
027   * Frees a simulated device.
028   *
029   * <p>This also allows the same device name to be used again. This also frees all the simulated
030   * values created on the device.
031   *
032   * @param handle simulated device handle
033   */
034  public static native void freeSimDevice(int handle);
035
036  private static native int createSimValueNative(
037      int device, String name, int direction, int type, long value1, double value2);
038
039  /**
040   * Creates a value on a simulated device.
041   *
042   * <p>Returns 0 if not in simulation; this can be used to avoid calls to Set/Get functions.
043   *
044   * @param device simulated device handle
045   * @param name value name
046   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
047   * @param initialValue initial value
048   * @return simulated value handle
049   */
050  public static int createSimValue(int device, String name, int direction, HALValue initialValue) {
051    return createSimValueNative(
052        device,
053        name,
054        direction,
055        initialValue.getType(),
056        initialValue.getNativeLong(),
057        initialValue.getNativeDouble());
058  }
059
060  /**
061   * Creates an int value on a simulated device.
062   *
063   * <p>Returns 0 if not in simulation; this can be used to avoid calls to Set/Get functions.
064   *
065   * @param device simulated device handle
066   * @param name value name
067   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
068   * @param initialValue initial value
069   * @return simulated value handle
070   */
071  public static int createSimValueInt(int device, String name, int direction, int initialValue) {
072    return createSimValueNative(device, name, direction, HALValue.kInt, initialValue, 0.0);
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Creates a long value on a simulated device.
077   *
078   * <p>Returns 0 if not in simulation; this can be used to avoid calls to Set/Get functions.
079   *
080   * @param device simulated device handle
081   * @param name value name
082   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
083   * @param initialValue initial value
084   * @return simulated value handle
085   */
086  public static int createSimValueLong(int device, String name, int direction, long initialValue) {
087    return createSimValueNative(device, name, direction, HALValue.kLong, initialValue, 0.0);
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Creates a double value on a simulated device.
092   *
093   * <p>Returns 0 if not in simulation; this can be used to avoid calls to Set/Get functions.
094   *
095   * @param device simulated device handle
096   * @param name value name
097   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
098   * @param initialValue initial value
099   * @return simulated value handle
100   */
101  public static int createSimValueDouble(
102      int device, String name, int direction, double initialValue) {
103    return createSimValueNative(device, name, direction, HALValue.kDouble, 0, initialValue);
104  }
105
106  /**
107   * Creates an enumerated value on a simulated device.
108   *
109   * <p>Enumerated values are always in the range 0 to numOptions-1.
110   *
111   * <p>Returns 0 if not in simulation; this can be used to avoid calls to Set/Get functions.
112   *
113   * @param device simulated device handle
114   * @param name value name
115   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
116   * @param options array of option descriptions
117   * @param initialValue initial value (selection)
118   * @return simulated value handle
119   */
120  public static native int createSimValueEnum(
121      int device, String name, int direction, String[] options, int initialValue);
122
123  /**
124   * Creates an enumerated value on a simulated device with double values.
125   *
126   * <p>Enumerated values are always in the range 0 to numOptions-1.
127   *
128   * <p>Returns 0 if not in simulation; this can be used to avoid calls to Set/Get functions.
129   *
130   * @param device simulated device handle
131   * @param name value name
132   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
133   * @param options array of option descriptions
134   * @param optionValues array of option values (must be the same size as options)
135   * @param initialValue initial value (selection)
136   * @return simulated value handle
137   */
138  public static native int createSimValueEnumDouble(
139      int device,
140      String name,
141      int direction,
142      String[] options,
143      double[] optionValues,
144      int initialValue);
145
146  /**
147   * Creates a boolean value on a simulated device.
148   *
149   * <p>Returns 0 if not in simulation; this can be used to avoid calls to Set/Get functions.
150   *
151   * @param device simulated device handle
152   * @param name value name
153   * @param direction input/output/bidir (from perspective of user code)
154   * @param initialValue initial value
155   * @return simulated value handle
156   */
157  public static int createSimValueBoolean(
158      int device, String name, int direction, boolean initialValue) {
159    return createSimValueNative(
160        device, name, direction, HALValue.kBoolean, initialValue ? 1 : 0, 0.0);
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Gets a simulated value.
165   *
166   * @param handle simulated value handle
167   * @return The current value
168   */
169  public static native HALValue getSimValue(int handle);
170
171  /**
172   * Gets a simulated value (int).
173   *
174   * @param handle simulated value handle
175   * @return The current value
176   */
177  public static native int getSimValueInt(int handle);
178
179  /**
180   * Gets a simulated value (long).
181   *
182   * @param handle simulated value handle
183   * @return The current value
184   */
185  public static native long getSimValueLong(int handle);
186
187  /**
188   * Gets a simulated value (double).
189   *
190   * @param handle simulated value handle
191   * @return The current value
192   */
193  public static native double getSimValueDouble(int handle);
194
195  /**
196   * Gets a simulated value (enum).
197   *
198   * @param handle simulated value handle
199   * @return The current value
200   */
201  public static native int getSimValueEnum(int handle);
202
203  /**
204   * Gets a simulated value (boolean).
205   *
206   * @param handle simulated value handle
207   * @return The current value
208   */
209  public static native boolean getSimValueBoolean(int handle);
210
211  private static native void setSimValueNative(int handle, int type, long value1, double value2);
212
213  /**
214   * Sets a simulated value.
215   *
216   * @param handle simulated value handle
217   * @param value the value to set
218   */
219  public static void setSimValue(int handle, HALValue value) {
220    setSimValueNative(handle, value.getType(), value.getNativeLong(), value.getNativeDouble());
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * Sets a simulated value (int).
225   *
226   * @param handle simulated value handle
227   * @param value the value to set
228   */
229  public static void setSimValueInt(int handle, int value) {
230    setSimValueNative(handle, HALValue.kInt, value, 0.0);
231  }
232
233  /**
234   * Sets a simulated value (long).
235   *
236   * @param handle simulated value handle
237   * @param value the value to set
238   */
239  public static void setSimValueLong(int handle, long value) {
240    setSimValueNative(handle, HALValue.kLong, value, 0.0);
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Sets a simulated value (double).
245   *
246   * @param handle simulated value handle
247   * @param value the value to set
248   */
249  public static void setSimValueDouble(int handle, double value) {
250    setSimValueNative(handle, HALValue.kDouble, 0, value);
251  }
252
253  /**
254   * Sets a simulated value (enum).
255   *
256   * @param handle simulated value handle
257   * @param value the value to set
258   */
259  public static void setSimValueEnum(int handle, int value) {
260    setSimValueNative(handle, HALValue.kEnum, value, 0.0);
261  }
262
263  /**
264   * Sets a simulated value (boolean).
265   *
266   * @param handle simulated value handle
267   * @param value the value to set
268   */
269  public static void setSimValueBoolean(int handle, boolean value) {
270    setSimValueNative(handle, HALValue.kBoolean, value ? 1 : 0, 0.0);
271  }
272
273  /**
274   * Resets a simulated double or integral value to 0. Has no effect on other value types. Use this
275   * instead of Set(0) for resetting incremental sensor values like encoder counts or gyro
276   * accumulated angle to ensure correct behavior in a distributed system (e.g. WebSockets).
277   *
278   * @param handle simulated value handle
279   */
280  public static native void resetSimValue(int handle);
281}
